author: mmcfalljohnsen@businessinsider.com (Morgan McFall-Johnsen), Morgan McFall-Johnsen
title: 6 countries' responses to the coronavirus are revealing which strategies work and which fall short. Widespread testing is crucial, while lockdowns can buy time.
description: REUTERS/Kim Kyung-Hoon Countries have taken a range of approaches to battling the new coronavirus. Widespread testing, contact tracing, and quarantining helped countries like South Korea and Singapore gain control over the first wave of cases. Lockdowns also …
content:
Business Insider
As the world stares down months of potential shutdowns and mounting medical battles to save coronavirus patients, everyone is trying to figure out how to best move forward.
